***Smidgen*** :)

Smidgen could feel the ship slowly sway in the boughs of the tree.  
She swallowed hard and tried to squelch the rising fear in her 
spark.  "I'm sure the guys will find me here in just a few minutes.  
Then things will be OK." she hoped. Fear showing itself in her voice.
She sat down in the pilot's chair and prayed to the matrix that the 
ship wouldn't fall. But who knows the fickleness of the Matrix. The 
ship rocked to one side and then the other as the wind pushed the 
small, helpless craft about. The ship creaked and the branches 
moaned under the weight of the ship.  Then there was a loud SNAP!!  
The front limb broke and the ship tilted downward, nose first.  
Smidgen screamed as the small vessal went crashing down towards 
earth.  The nose of the ship gave out a sickening crunch as it was 
pushed inward.  Smidgen was thrown forward by the force of the 
impact.  Her body was flung towards the console. She hit the console 
full on.  The ship was now sticking straight up and down, nose down 
and tail up high.  She muttered, "Thank the Matrix I'm OK."
She started to sit up and look around.  Just as she was looking at 
the pilots console, the little red light was still flashing. The 
homing beacon was still going. Things might be picking up she 
thought. Then just as she went to move, a small tool kit that was 
originally on the wall behind her seat was balancing on the back of 
her chair.  Then if fell, hitting her on the head.  The last thing 
she remembered was hearing a clanging noise abover her, then the 
world went black.
